story:
Once upon a time, in the beautiful land of Ethiopia, there was a small village nestled in the lush, green valley. The village was home to many families, and they all lived in harmony with one another. The children would play together, the women would cook and tend to their homes, and the men would work in the fields and take care of the animals.

In this village lived a young boy named Kelemu. Kelemu was a kind, curious, and adventurous boy who loved exploring the beautiful land around him. He would often wander through the fields, climb trees, and swim in the river that ran through the valley.

One day, while Kelemu was exploring the outskirts of the village, he stumbled upon a hidden cave. Intrigued, he decided to venture inside and see what secrets it held. As he wandered deeper into the cave, he noticed that the walls were adorned with beautiful paintings.

The paintings depicted scenes of animals, warriors, and kings. Kelemu couldn't believe his eyes. He had never seen such beautiful art before. As he continued to explore, he came upon a large, ornate chest. With trembling hands, he opened the chest and found a small, golden horn.

As soon as Kelemu picked up the horn, a voice spoke to him. "Thank you for freeing me, young one. I am the Spirit of the Land, and I have been trapped in this horn for centuries. In return for your kindness, I will grant you one wish."

Kelemu was overjoyed and thought carefully before making his wish. He wished for the wisdom to help his village grow and prosper, and the strength to protect it from harm. The Spirit of the Land granted his wish and vanished, leaving the golden horn behind.

From that day forward, Kelemu became a leader in his village. He used his wisdom to help his people make the right decisions, and his strength to defend them from any dangers. The village prospered, and the people were happy and grateful for their wise and brave leader.

And so, Kelemu's legend lived on, passed down from generation to generation, as a reminder that kindness and bravery can lead to greatness.

My dear son, as you close your eyes and drift off to sleep, remember that you too have the potential for greatness within you. Dream big, be kind, and never be afraid to explore the world around you. Goodnight, my dear one, and may all your dreams come true.
